questions.question: Who is primarily credited with developing the theory of relativity?
The theory of relativity consists of two parts: the special theory of relativity and what other theory?
According to Einstein's theory of relativity, what does E=mc^2 mean?
options: Energy equals mass times the speed of light squared
Energy equals mass times the speed of light
Energy equals mass times the square root of the speed of light
Energy equals mass times the square of the speed of light
questions.correct_answer: Energy equals mass times the speed of light squared

questions.question: In the special theory of relativity, what is considered constant for all observers?
What does the general theory of relativity primarily deal with?
According to relativity, as an object approaches the speed of light, its mass will...
What does 'spacetime' refer to in the context of relativity?
options: A model that fuses the three dimensions of space and the one dimension of time into a four-dimensional continuum
The process of time dilation and length contraction
questions.correct_answer: A model that fuses the three dimensions of space and the one dimension of time into a four-dimensional continuum

questions.question: According to the theory of relativity, what happens to time as an object approaches the speed of light?
What is 'time dilation' in the context of relativity?
options: The process by which time speeds up in stronger gravitational fields
The process by which time slows down in stronger gravitational fields
The process by which time speeds up as one moves faster
The process by which time slows down as one moves faster
questions.correct_answer: The process by which time slows down as one moves faster

questions.question: What is 'length contraction' in the context of relativity?
options: The process by which objects shorten in their direction of motion as they approach the speed of light
The process by which objects lengthen in their direction of motion as they approach the speed of light
The process by which objects shorten in their direction of motion as they slow down
The process by which objects lengthen in their direction of motion as they slow down
questions.correct_answer: The process by which objects shorten in their direction of motion as they approach the speed of light
